description: Chun Ware Bowl, porcelaneous stoneware with blue glaze
medium:
Chun ware 
Stoneware with pale blue glaze
text: Of all the major ceramic types produced in north China during late Northern Sung (11th-early 12th centuries), Chun ware from Honan province is unique for its color suffused blue glazes. The depth and color of Chun glaze varies considerably. This bowl has a relatively thin pale blue glaze with a subtle crackle pattern.
title: Bowl
